meanings.definition: To evade or dodge a question or responsibility.
meanings.sent1: He was weaselling out of doing his chores by pretending to be sick.
meanings.sent2: She always tries weaselling her way out of taking the trash out.
meanings.sent3: The cat was weaselling around the house, trying to avoid getting a bath.
meanings.sent4: The politician was weaselling his way through the tough questions during the interview.
meanings.sent5: The student was weaselling out of studying by claiming to have too much homework.

meanings.definition: The act of behaving in a sneaky or deceitful manner.
meanings.sent1: His weaselling around the office eventually got him into trouble.
meanings.sent2: She saw through his weaselling and confronted him about his lies.
meanings.sent3: The weaselling behavior of the raccoon trying to steal food from the campsite was both amusing and annoying.
meanings.sent4: The weaselling ways of the con artist were finally exposed by the police.
meanings.sent5: The weaselling nature of the fox made it difficult for the farmer to protect his chickens.
